answers.author: Derek Johnson
answers.text:
Pamela,
This off-site work policy document from the Delaware County Board of Developmental Disabilities provides an insight into common policies and procedures regarding off-site employees. Some of the information is only applicable to employees working from home, but in general most of the rules and regulations concern coordination and communication between those off-site and whatever hub they're looking to stay connected to (in this case, City Hall). It's worth checking out if your client is looking for a typical example of how to stay plugged-in to the nexus of information when you can't physically be there.
http://bit.ly/8ZdDKY
For an example of how a public body designs and runs their teleconferencing system, please see this 2001 document "Ecamples of Community Use Policies" outlining policies and procedures for videoconferencing with outside groups. 
Their system is interesting in that videoconferencing with most other elements of the local government (City Hall, in your example) would not come with a charge. However, outside organizations such as non-profits, private companies or state government agencies may also use the technology, though they are charged a fee to do so. 
http://bit.ly/aJXvCp
For a more general education on best practices concerning teleconferencing, this manual written by the Commonwealth Educational Media Centre for Asia (CEMCA) goes into depth, citing multiple case studies, explaining the technology behind teleconferencing and guidelines for orientation of personnel. 
http://bit.ly/8Zf78I
Derek Johnson

author: Pamela Muse
text:
The City of Redondo Beach, CA is moving its Recreation and Community Services Department from a 12,000 square foot campus to a 6,000 sq. foot modular structure.  As well, the offices will be much farther from City Hall.  They are interested in what others do to stay connected; teleconferencing systems, GoToMeeting, WebEX, closed circuit, etc.  
If you are using technology tools to stay connected/communicate with off-site city offices, please let us know what resources you have implemented, including vendors,  please forward ASAP.  
Thank you!  
Pamela Muse  
Western Regional Director  
Alliance for Innovation  
888-468-6450  
pmuse@transformgov.org
title: Technology Tools to Stay Connected w/Off Site Offices
